page.title: 01Coastline of Coldingham Bay
page.content: This part of the Berwickshre coastline mainly consists of rocky clifs rising to 500 ft at St Abbs Head, to the north of the block. The majority of land cover in this block is covered by the North Sea, with two parts of the coastline projecting into the sea The predominant feature of this rocky coastline is Coldingham Bay which is situated half a mile east of Coldingham Village. Coldingham Bay is a popular tourist attraction in Berwickshre with half a mile of golden sandy beach, backed by dense grassy cliffs and scattered with numerous beachhuts. The access is limited by a single tracked road. Tourist development include various hotel complexes and a youth hostel. The village of St Abbs lies to the north of Coldingham Bay and is a traditional
